section.title: Getting system information with command line tool dumpsys
adb dumpsys
section.para: The adb dumpsys command allows you to retain information about the Android system and the running applications.
To get currently memory consumption of an application you can use the following command.

section.title: Memory consumption overview with dumpsys
section.para: The adb shell procrank lists you all application in the order of their memory consumption. This command does not work on real device. Use the adb shell dumpsys meminfo instead.

section.title: Information about scheduled tasks
section.para: To find which alarms are scheduled for your application, use the adb shell dumpsys alarm command and look for your package name. The output might be similar to the following:
This shows the info that the alarm is scheduled for approx. 12 minutes.

section.title: Battery information tasks
section.para: As of Android 5.0 you can also get information about the battery consumption of an application.
